thread.title: Britton Colquitt, Broncos agree to reduced salary for 2015
thread.title_full: Britton Colquitt, Broncos agree to reduced salary for 2015 - The Denver Post

author: Troy E. Renck and Nicki Jhabvala
title: Britton Colquitt, Broncos agree to reduced salary for 2015
text:
The Broncos have restructured the contract of punter Britton Colquitt, reducing his base salary by $1.4 million for 2015, an NFL source confirmed.
Colquitt signed a three-year, $11.7 million extension in 2013 that made him the league's highest-paid punter with an average salary of $3.9 million per year. His new $1.6 million salary, down from the $3 million he was set to earn, applies only to 2015; his salary for 2016, the final year on his deal, remains at $3.25 million.
The changed contract increases the chances Colquitt will remain the Broncos' punter.
The team had signed kicker/punter Karl Schmitz in March. But the 28-year-old rookie from Jacksonville University who gained a following on YouTube hasn't played in a game since 2008.
Colquitt is the second Broncos player to take less money this season. Quarterback Peyton Manning agreed to a $4 million pay cut, for a salary of $15 million. His $19 million salary for 2016 remains unchanged.
The extra money from Manning's contract gave the Broncos some needed room to go shopping in free agency after losing a number of key veterans on the open market.
ESPN first reported Colquitt's restructured contract.
